info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 3:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN SANTA FE COUNTY THROUGH 400 PM MDT... At 329 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Nambe Pueblo, or 8 miles south of Chimayo, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Santa Fe, White Rock, Pojoaque, Nambe Lake, Nambe Pueblo, Cundiyo, Rio En Medio in Santa Fe County, Tesuque, Pojoaque Pueblo and Cuyamungue. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.
